questions.question: I have always …………….. play games well.
questions.description: Can and could have no infinitives or participles. For example, there are no forms like I have could ….

questions.question: He has always …………….. to do what he wanted.
questions.description: Can and could have no infinitives or participles. For example, there are no forms like I have could ….

questions.question: One cannot help but …………….. his courage.
questions.description: The infinitive is used without to in the structure cannot help but..

questions.question: …………….do you want a holiday?
questions.description: We use how much in questions about degree.

questions.question: I will have tea …………… coffee.
questions.description: As a preposition, instead is used with of.

questions.question: They often go fishing …………….. going to school.
questions.description: Instead of is used when a person, thing or action replaces another.

questions.question: Stella often goes to the movies …………… telling her parents.
I am interested ……………….. what she did with that money.
questions.description: Interested + ing and interested + infinitive can both be used to talk about a wish to find out something.

questions.question: At no time …………….. aware of what was happening.
questions.description: If a negative expression comes at the beginning of a clause, it is usually followed by auxiliary verb + subject.

questions.question: Only then ………….. understand what he meant.
questions.description: If a negative expression comes at the beginning of a clause, it is usually followed by auxiliary verb + subject.

questions.question: I wondered what time …………….
questions.description: In indirect questions the subject goes before the verb.

questions.question: I tried …………… the doctor but my hands were numb.
questions.description: We can use either an infinitive or an ing form after 'try' to talk about making an effort to do something.
